org.drooms.impl

Class DefaultGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drooms.impl.GameController
      • org.drooms.impl.DefaultGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Game

    public class DefaultGame
extends GameController
    On top of the rules implemented by GameController, this game implementation also puts forward some of its own. Those are:
    Collision detection
    When a worm reaches a node at the same time as another worm, both are terminated. When a worm moves into a body of another worm or into a wall, only this worm is terminated. Specific probabilities and values come from the game config.
    Various types of collectibles
    This class implements three types of collectibles with varying probabilities of appearance, expirations and valuations. There are cheap ones that occur all the time, good ones that occur sometimes and extremely lucrative ones that occur scarcely and don't last long.
    Simultaneos collections
    When two worms collect the same item at the same time, it is considered a collision. Both worms are terminated and neither is awarded points for the item.
    Survival bonuses
    In the turn when at least one worm is removed from the game, either due to crashing or inactivity, every surviving worm is rewarded. The amount of the reward is "the number of worms gone so far" multiplied by the bonus factor.
    Inactivity enforcement
    This implementation will terminate worms for inactivity, as described in the super class.
